quoteFirst: _Princess Royal_ set fire to a three-funnelled battleship; _New Zealand_ and _Indomitable_ report that the third ship, which they both engaged, hauled out of the line, heeling over and on fire. The mist which now came down enveloped them, and _Falmouth_ reported they were last seen at
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: Cruiser Squadron (the last ships to keep in touch) at
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: The _Calliope_ was hit several times but did not sustain serious damage, although, I regret to say, she had several casualties. The light cruisers attacked the enemy’s battleships with torpedoes at this time, but were not able to observe the result; an explosion on board a ship of the “Kaiser” class was seen, however, at
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: [M] The ships sighted turned away and touch could not be regained, although sounds of gunfire could be heard from ahead at 8.25 P.M., probably from our battle cruisers, which obtained touch with and engaged some of the enemy’s ships very effectively between 8.22 and 8.25 P.M. The _Falmouth_ was the last ship of the Battle Cruiser Fleet to be in touch with the enemy, at
quoteLast: ; the ships then in sight turned eight points together away from the _Falmouth_.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: _New Zealand_ and _Indomitable_ report that the third ship, which they both engaged, hauled out of the line, heeling over and on fire. The mist which now came down enveloped them, and _Falmouth_ reported they were last seen at
title: World's War Events, Vol. II
author: Reynolds, Francis J. (Francis Joseph), 1867-1937 [Editor]; Churchill, Allen L. (Allen Leon), 1873-1940 [Editor]

quoteFirst: _Indomitable_ and _New Zealand_ engaged a third and sent her out of the line, heeling over and burning also. Then the mist came down once more and the enemy was last seen by _Falmouth_ at
title: The British Navy in Battle
author: Pollen, Arthur Joseph Hungerford, 1866-1937

quoteFirst: m.; new moon, 15th, at 12:43 a. m.; first quarter, 21st, at 6:12 p. m.; full moon, 29th, at 1:06 a. m. Rises on the 1st, at
quoteLast: ; sets on the 16th, at 8:28 p. m.; rises on the 30th, at 8:21 p. m. In latitude 41° 30′ north, least elevation on the 6th, and equals 30° 20′; greatest elevation on the 19th, equals 66° 44′ 29″.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, April 1885
